title: Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull urged to rein in gas exports in bid to avert energy security crisis: AWU
text: Listen to Tuesday's program Loading the player... AM is Australia's most informative morning current affairs program. AM sets the agenda for the nationÂ’s daily news and current affairs coverage. Search AM Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull urged to rein in gas exports in bid to avert energy security crisis: AWU | MP3 download Multinationals should be forced to renegotiate lucrative contracts that allow unrestricted gas exports in a bid to avert an energy security crisis, according to one of Australia's most powerful trade unions.The Australian Workers Union (AWU) has written to Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull urging him to 'act decisively and rationally in the national interest' to ensure a portion of Australia's natural gas is quarantined for domestic use.
